meanings.definition: To strike or hit something with a ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: She was donging the bell to signal the end of the school day.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith was donging the metal to shape it into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent3: The monkey started donging the coconut like a drum, creating a funny rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The rain was donging on the roof, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The woodpecker was donging on the tree trunk, searching for insects.

meanings.definition: The act of striking or hitting something with a ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: The loud donging of the church bell could be heard throughout the village.
meanings.sent2: The constant donging of the hammer on the anvil echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected donging of the doorbell made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The donging of the grandfather clock marked each passing hour with precision.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic donging of the gong signaled the start of the ceremony.
